content.raw:
Right, that's effectively the same as what `ign-common` is doing, just not as succinctly.

I'm not a fan of that because I think users (who have no need to be concerned about the ugliness of how symbols are exported on Windows) may find that block of preprocessor directives alarming and distracting. I won't contest it as a temporary solution to this issue, but I think we should very seriously consider how to make the cross-platform warning suppression feature available to all of our libraries.

Edit: I mean we should consider it for future development, not for our current code freeze schedule.
